title: How to Change Your Screen from Vertical to Horizontal

steps.title: Open Control Center.
steps.content: Open Control Center. If your iPhone or iPad does not have a home button, swipe down and left from the top-right corner of the screen to open Control Center. [1] X Research source If your iPhone or iPad has a home button, Control Center can be opened by swiping up from the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Disable rotation lock.
steps.content: Disable rotation lock. Look for the square icon with a lock and a circular arrow inside of it. If the lock is unlocked and the icon is grey and white, it is disabled. If the lock is locked and the icon is red and white, it is enabled. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open a compatible app and turn your iPhone or iPad sideways.
steps.content: Open a compatible app and turn your iPhone or iPad sideways. Open an app that can be viewed horizontally like Safari or Messages and turn your iPhone or iPad. Your screen should automatically rotate! Currently, you can only rotate the home screen on iPhone Plus and Max models. This can be done by going to the home screen and holding your phone horizontally. You can rotate the home screen on an iPad simply by holding it horizontally.

steps.title: Open Quick settings.
steps.content: Open Quick settings. Quick settings can be opened by swiping down twice from the top of your screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the gear icon.
steps.content: Tap the gear icon. This will open the Settings app on your phone or tablet. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Display.
steps.content: Select Display . This category allows you to manipulate a variety of settings related to the screen of your phone or tablet.

steps.title: Press Auto-rotate screen.
steps.content: Press Auto-rotate screen . Scroll until you find the Auto-rotate screen category, then tap it to bring up screen rotation options. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the toggles next to “Use Auto-rotate” and “Enable Face Detection”.
steps.content: Tap the toggles next to “Use Auto-rotate” and “Enable Face Detection”. In Android 12, Google augmented auto-rotate with a face detection feature. Enabling auto-rotate is necessary to easily rotate your phone or tablet, but you can choose if you want to enable face detection for more accurate rotations.

steps.title: Open a compatible app and turn your phone or tablet sideways.
steps.content: Open a compatible app and turn your phone or tablet sideways. Your apps can now easily be rotated on your phone or tablet! Be sure that the app you are trying to rotate has a horizontal interface, otherwise, it will not rotate.

steps.title: Hold down on an empty spot on your home screen.
steps.content: Hold down on an empty spot on your home screen. If you want to rotate your home screen on your phone, follow these extra steps to make that possible. If you are using a tablet, you can rotate your home screen by simply rotating the tablet horizontally.

steps.title: Press Home settings.
steps.content: Press Home settings . This will open a menu of settings specific to your home screen.

steps.title: Enable home screen rotation.
steps.content: Enable home screen rotation. Depending on your phone and its version of Android, you will need to enable something like “Allow Home screen rotation” or disable something like “Portrait mode only” by tapping the toggle to the right of the option. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Return to your home screen and turn your phone sideways.
steps.content: Return to your home screen and turn your phone sideways. Your home screen should now be able to rotate!

steps.title: Follow the steps in the methods above.
steps.content: Follow the steps in the methods above. Follow the appropriate method above to ensure your phone or tablet screen can rotate while disconnected from external displays.

steps.title: Connect your phone or tablet to your external display.
steps.content: Connect your phone or tablet to your external display. Try opening different apps or swiping between pages of your home screen to ensure your external display is updating properly. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Turn your phone or tablet sideways.
steps.content: Turn your phone or tablet sideways. After rotating your phone or tablet, the screen on your external display should automatically update with the new orientation! [8] X Research source
